* * *

####

App by Oracle

NVIDIA GPU Cloud is a GPU-accelerated platform optimized for deep learning and
scientific computing.

  

NVIDIA NGC is a hub for GPU-optimized software, for pulling and running
performance-tuned, tested, and NVIDIA certified docker containers. The NGC
catalog provides free access to containerized AI, data science, HPC
applications, pre-trained models, AI SDKs and other resources to enable data
scientists, developers, and researchers to focus on building and deploying
solutions.

  
NVIDIA AI Enterprise, an end-to-end, secure, cloud-native suite of AI
software, is certified to run on the GPU Cloud Machine Image on OCI. Included
with NVIDIA AI Enterprise is global enterprise support and regular security
reviews to ensure business continuity and AI projects stay on track. An NVIDIA
AI Enterprise license can be purchased through an NVIDIA channel partner for
use on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure.

This document provides an overview of the NVIDIA NGC and how to use it with
the OCI instances.

####

Usage Information

  

Usage Instructions

1\. When launching the instance, you will need to provide an SSH key that you
previously created. For more information please see: Managing Key Pairs

2\. Once the instance launches, you can connect to it using SSH. For detailed
instructions, please see this page:  Accessing Your Instance  
   IP address:  use the public IP address of the instance  
   User: ubuntu  
   For example:  
   $ ssh -i mykey.pem ubuntu@IPaddress

3\. For general usage instructions follow: Getting Started Using NVIDIA GPU
Cloud

####

Support

Free support through NVIDIA Developer Forum

NVIDIA Enterprise Support (paid)

Less

More
